rules.text: BE THOUGHTFUL. If you wouldn't say it during fellowship after the rise of meeting, think about whether to say it here.
BE ANTI-RACIST, ANTI-MISOGYNISTIC, AND ANTI-HOMO/TRANSPHOBIC. Do some positive work toward making this space welcoming to traditionally marginalized folks, and when you're called in, listen.
BE AUTHENTIC. If it's safe for you to do so, please sign up with your real name.

BE INTERESTING AND INTERESTED. Help make Quakers.Social a lively place. Post about your ministry or calling, your spiritiual life, and so on. Plus, on Mastodon there's no algorithm, just boosting and favouriting, so do plenty of both.
BE SAFE. If you say anything here that seems to the moderators to put anyone in any kind of danger, you get one warning, then your account will be disabled.

DON'T VIOLATE ANYONE'S COPYRIGHT. Please see the Quakers.Social DMCA Policy (https://meta.quakers.social/dmca-policy) for more information about what to do if you believe your rights have been infringed or if you have received a request to take down copyrighted material.

records.text: This summer, Pendle Hill will be a hybrid hub for the Friends World Committee for Consultation - FWCC World Office World Plenary Meeting from August 5-12. Friends are invited to book a sojourn or commute to Pendle Hill’s campus for some or all of the plenary time, and come together in the Barn to participate as a community. Learn more and book your stay at https://pendlehill.org/events/friends-world-committee-for-consultation-world-plenary-meeting/

records.text: Will you be in the neighborhood July 21st? Then please join us for a nature walk around our 24-acre campus from 1:30 - 3:00 pm! Explore the grounds and all the unique natural and social ecosystems at Pendle Hill with biologist, John Gruber, and Facilities and Grounds Manager, Lloyd Guindon! This event is free and open to the public: https://pendlehill.org/events/pendle-hill-nature-walk-2024/And you're invited to stick around after the walk for a neighbor meet and greet with reception and tour of historic Upmeads from 3-4 pm.

records.text: Will you be in the neighborhood July 21st? Then please join us for a nature walk around our 24-acre campus from 1:30 - 3:00 pm!
